ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I furthered my contrast and drawing skills.
I learned a lot about gesture and line. I have little experience with figure drawings and loose sketches, and I developed skills in these areas a lot in this course.
I learned the basics of drawing and how to critique art.
A better eye to examine the world, a better hand to draw it with.
I learned how to draw, basically. I came in with zero knowledge and saw myself improve.
I learned how to draw.
Basic drawing skills and practice

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength of the course was its flexibility. A weakness was that it was hard to reach the professor. A lack of personal instruction.

I really appreciate the freedom given to create in this class, as well as the figure drawing. I know that it is a beginner level class, but even so, I would appreciate more of an emphasis on improving specific drawing techniques in detail.

This course is fairly unorganized. The professor does not use Canvas, so you never really know what your grades are on assignments. Thus, you really have no knowledge on your class performance until the very end. Throughout the entire semester, we only received feedback on our midterm, despite having several other assignments.
It would be great to receive more feedback on our art as we went along, but practice makes perfect!
I felt that I did not have as much feedback on my work as I would have wanted.

The strength of the course is Meleko and Zoe, so just in general, the teaching team. The weakness of the course is sometimes short notice about assignment due dates, which creates stress among students, and also limited communication about grades up until your final grade comes out.

Weaknesses are the grading schema. Very unclear about how the midterm, small assignments, and large assignments played a percentage role in the grading. The teacher also NEVER responds to email nor does he update the syllabus. The TA, Zoe was absolutely lovely.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student who wishes to push their drawing habits and study realism.
I would, especially to someone who isn't very experienced in art. It's a great way to explore the subject.

I would recommend this course to another student if they're interested in drawing. However, this course is not really a gut and will require quite a bit of effort, especially if you're a beginner. The grading of assignments is also much stricter than you'd expect, given that this is a basic drawing course. In the end, I felt more stress from this course than I expected to.
A great compliment to the rest of your workload. Also, fantastic for deepening your appreciation for art, and your own self-reflection.
This was a very fun course. I would recommend it to anyone looking to gain some art experience.

yes, I would 100% recommend this course to every single student. It changed my semester; it helped keep me sane. I learned so much about myself, my passions, and strengthened my drawing abilities. I grew so much and I made great relationships with everybody in the class and learned so much about them.
Yes but don't expect it to be a gut: you will have to draw a LOT and the evaluation metrics are not lax.
